summary: This is a billing letter from American Express/DATAMARK to the FBI acknowledging receipt of a subpoena for financial records related to an account and detailing the costs for document production. It indicates an ongoing financial investigation.

events.title: Payment Due Date for Subpoena Compliance
events.description: The due date for payment of costs associated with producing records in response to a subpoena.

keyFacts: The FBI subpoenaed financial records from American Express/DATAMARK related to a specific account (No. 07143MQR1000153482).
American Express acknowledged the subpoena and provided documents, noting that statements are not generated for months with no account activity.
The cost for producing the records was $207.50, with an original due date of August 9, 2007.
This document is a 2nd notice for payment related to the subpoena compliance, dated October 10, 2007.
The document is part of the Epstein case files, indicating financial records were sought as part of the investigation.
